propDescriptions.calendars: The number of calendars that render on desktop.
propDescriptions.className: className applied to the root component.
propDescriptions.closeOnSelect: If true the popup or dialog will immediately close after submitting full date.
propDescriptions.componentsProps: The props used for each component slot.
propDescriptions.dayOfWeekFormatter:
Formats the day of week displayed in the calendar header.

Signature:
function(day: string) => string
day: The day of week provided by the adapter's method getWeekdays.
returns (string): The name to display.
propDescriptions.desktopModeMediaQuery: CSS media query when Mobile mode will be changed to Desktop.
propDescriptions.disableAutoMonthSwitching: If true, after selecting start date calendar will not automatically switch to the month of end date.
propDescriptions.disabled: If true, the picker and text field are disabled.
propDescriptions.disableFuture: If true disable values before the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components.
propDescriptions.disableHighlightToday: If true, today's date is rendering without highlighting with circle.
propDescriptions.disableMaskedInput: Disable mask on the keyboard, this should be used rarely. Consider passing proper mask for your format.
propDescriptions.disableOpenPicker: Do not render open picker button (renders only text field with validation).
propDescriptions.disablePast: If true disable values after the current date for date components, time for time components and both for date time components.
propDescriptions.displayWeekNumber: If true, the week number will be display in the calendar. Needs to provide getWeekNumber if the adapter does not support getWeekNumber
propDescriptions.fixedWeekNumber: Calendar will show more weeks in order to match this value. Put it to 6 for having fix number of week in Gregorian calendars
propDescriptions.getOpenDialogAriaText:
Get aria-label text for control that opens picker dialog. Aria-label text must include selected date. @DateIOType

Signature:
function(date: TDate | null, utils: MuiPickersAdapter<TDate>) => string
date: The date from which we want to add an aria-text.
utils: The utils to manipulate the date.
returns (string): The aria-text to render inside the dialog.
propDescriptions.getWeekNumber:
Get the week number form keek first day

Signature:
function(date: TDate) => number
date: The first day of the week.
returns (number): The displayed week number
propDescriptions.InputAdornmentProps: Props to pass to keyboard input adornment.
propDescriptions.inputRef: Pass a ref to the input element.
propDescriptions.loading: If true renders LoadingComponent in calendar instead of calendar view. Can be used to preload information and show it in calendar.
propDescriptions.mask: Custom mask. Can be used to override generate from format. (e.g. __/__/____ __:__ or __/__/____ __:__ _M).
propDescriptions.onAccept:
Callback fired when date is accepted @DateIOType.

Signature:
function(value: TValue) => void
value: The value that was just accepted.
propDescriptions.onChange:
Callback fired when the value (the selected date range) changes @DateIOType.

Signature:
function(date: DateRange<TDate>, keyboardInputValue: string) => void
date: The new date range.
keyboardInputValue: The current value of the keyboard input.
propDescriptions.onClose: Callback fired when the popup requests to be closed. Use in controlled mode (see open).
propDescriptions.onError:
Callback that fired when input value or new value prop validation returns new validation error (or value is valid after error). In case of validation error detected reason prop return non-null value and TextField must be displayed in error state. This can be used to render appropriate form error.
Read the guide about form integration and error displaying.

Signature:
function(reason: TError, value: TValue) => void
reason: The reason why the current value is not valid.
value: The invalid value.
propDescriptions.onMonthChange:
Callback firing on month change @DateIOType.

Signature:
function(month: TDate) => void | Promise
month: The new month.
returns (void | Promise): -
propDescriptions.onOpen: Callback fired when the popup requests to be opened. Use in controlled mode (see open).
propDescriptions.onViewChange:
Callback fired on view change.

Signature:
function(view: CalendarPickerView) => void
view: The new view.
propDescriptions.open: Control the popup or dialog open state.
propDescriptions.OpenPickerButtonProps: Props to pass to keyboard adornment button.
propDescriptions.renderInput:
The renderInput prop allows you to customize the rendered input. The startProps and endProps arguments of this render prop contains props of TextField, that you need to forward to the range start/end inputs respectively. Pay specific attention to the ref and inputProps keys.

Signature:
function(startProps: MuiTextFieldProps, endProps: MuiTextFieldProps) => React.ReactElement
startProps: Props that you need to forward to the range start input.
endProps: Props that you need to forward to the range end input.
returns (React.ReactElement): The range input to render.
propDescriptions.renderLoading:
Component displaying when passed loading true.

Signature:
function() => React.ReactNode

returns (React.ReactNode): The node to render when loading.
propDescriptions.rifmFormatter:
Custom formatter to be passed into Rifm component.

Signature:
function(str: string) => string
str: The un-formatted string.
returns (string): The formatted string.
propDescriptions.shouldDisableDate:
Disable specific date. @DateIOType

Signature:
function(day: TDate, position: string) => boolean
day: The date to test.
position: The date to test, 'start' or 'end'.
returns (boolean): Returns true if the date should be disabled.
propDescriptions.shouldDisableMonth:
Disable specific month.

Signature:
function(month: TDate) => boolean
month: The month to test.
returns (boolean): If true the month will be disabled.
propDescriptions.shouldDisableYear:
Disable specific year.

Signature:
function(year: TDate) => boolean
year: The year to test.
returns (boolean): If true the year will be disabled.
propDescriptions.showDaysOutsideCurrentMonth: If true, days that have outsideCurrentMonth={true} are displayed.
propDescriptions.showToolbar: If true, show the toolbar even in desktop mode.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.

slotDescriptions.Toolbar: Custom component for the toolbar rendered above the views.
slotDescriptions.Day: Custom component for day in range pickers. Check the DateRangePickersDay component.
slotDescriptions.SwitchViewButton: Button displayed to switch between different calendar views.
slotDescriptions.SwitchViewIcon: Icon displayed in the SwitchViewButton. Rotated by 180Â° when the open view is 'year'.
slotDescriptions.PreviousIconButton: Button allowing to switch to the left view.
slotDescriptions.NextIconButton: Button allowing to switch to the right view.
slotDescriptions.LeftArrowIcon: Icon displayed in the left view switch button.
slotDescriptions.RightArrowIcon: Icon displayed in the right view switch button.
slotDescriptions.Dialog: Custom component for the dialog inside which the views are rendered on mobile.
slotDescriptions.MobilePaper: Custom component for the paper rendered inside the mobile picker's Dialog.
slotDescriptions.MobileTransition: Custom component for the mobile dialog Transition.
slotDescriptions.ActionBar: Custom component for the action bar, it is placed bellow the picker views.
slotDescriptions.OpenPickerIcon: Icon displayed in the open picker button.
slotDescriptions.DesktopPaper: Custom component for the paper rendered inside the desktop picker's Popper.
slotDescriptions.DesktopTransition: Custom component for the desktop popper Transition.
slotDescriptions.DesktopTrapFocus: Custom component for trapping the focus inside the views on desktop.
slotDescriptions.Popper: Custom component for the popper inside which the views are rendered on desktop.
slotDescriptions.PaperContent: Custom component wrapping the views of the desktop and static pickers (it is the direct child of the Paper component).
